title: Nimesulide painkiller ban: Centre bars oral formulations over 100 mg, cites health risks
description: The central government has imposed an immediate ban on the manufacture, sale and distribution of all oral formulations of the painkiller nimesulide containing more than 100 mg in immediate-release form, citing risks to human health and the availability of safer alternatives. The decision, taken under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act after expert consultation, was notified by the health ministry. Separately, the ministry proposed changes to the Drugs Rules, inviting public feedback within 30 days.

From politically incorrect characters and impulsive, morally messy narratives to the rise of script-led coming-of-age stories that trusted discomfort, 2025 belonged to cinema that chose conviction over calibration.

title: Khaleda Zia’s funeral: Thousands gather in Dhaka to pay last respects — live updates

Her death marks the end of an era for the influential BNP chairperson.

title: Water contamination kills 3 in Indore: Hospitals see rush of patients
description: Three people died in Indore's Bhagirathpura area after consuming contaminated water, with over 15,000 residents affected by diarrhoea and vomiting. The contamination was traced to a newly constructed toilet dumping waste into a sinkhole above a water supply line joint. Authorities are flushing pipelines and supplying water via tankers while investigating the incident.

title: British Indian high achievers recognised in King’s New Year Honours
description: Several individuals of South Asian heritage have been recognized in the King's New Year Honours List 2026 for significant community contributions. Notable recipients include Meera Syal and Meena Upadhyaya, who received damehoods. The list also features CBEs, OBEs, and MBEs awarded to those making a difference in charity, business, education, and the arts.

title: Spanish grape-eating ritual: Can eating 12 grapes on New Year’s Eve bring love, luck in 2026?
description: A Spanish New Year's Eve tradition, 'Las Doce Uvas de la Suerte,' involves eating 12 grapes at midnight for good fortune. This custom, originating in late 1800s Madrid, has a modern social media twist: eating grapes under the table for amplified luck and manifesting love, luck, and prosperity.  Pop culture and viral stories highlight its perceived effectiveness.

title: Candace Owens highlights new claims after eyewitness details on Charlie Kirk death
description: Candace Owens says Mitch Snow’s claims about Charlie Kirk’s death need verified timelines, not assumptions. Snow, a retired Army medic, says he was at Fort Huachuca and saw key figures. Online users question his memory and details. No official proof confirms his account. Owens asks for solid evidence to settle the debate.
